trans-unit.source: Managing and Auditing Access to Resources
trans-unit.target: Managing and Auditing Access to Resources

trans-unit.source: Use role-based access control (RBAC) to manage user permissions for resources deployed to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Use role-based access control (RBAC) to manage user permissions for resources deployed to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Managing and Auditing Access to Resources
trans-unit.target: Managing and Auditing Access to Resources

trans-unit.source: With Azure Resource Manager, you can make sure the users in your organization have the appropriate permissions to manage or access resources.
trans-unit.target: With Azure Resource Manager, you can make sure the users in your organization have the appropriate permissions to manage or access resources.

trans-unit.source: Resource Manager takes advantage of role-based access control (RBAC) so you can easily apply security policies to individual resources or resource groups.
trans-unit.target: Resource Manager takes advantage of role-based access control (RBAC) so you can easily apply security policies to individual resources or resource groups.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can grant a user access to a specific virtual machine in a subscription, or give a user the ability to manage all websites in a subscription but no other resources.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can grant a user access to a specific virtual machine in a subscription, or give a user the ability to manage all websites in a subscription but no other resources.

trans-unit.source: Concepts
trans-unit.target: Concepts

trans-unit.source: There are a few key concepts about role-based access control for you to understand:
trans-unit.target: There are a few key concepts about role-based access control for you to understand:

trans-unit.source: Principal - the entity granted permission, such as a user, security group, or application.
trans-unit.target: Principal - the entity granted permission, such as a user, security group, or application.

trans-unit.source: Role - set of permitted actions
trans-unit.target: Role - set of permitted actions

trans-unit.source: Scope - the level a role applies to, such as the subscription, resource group, or resource.
trans-unit.target: Scope - the level a role applies to, such as the subscription, resource group, or resource.

trans-unit.source: Role Assignment - the process of adding a principal to a role and setting the scope.
trans-unit.target: Role Assignment - the process of adding a principal to a role and setting the scope.

trans-unit.source: Role examples
trans-unit.target: Role examples

trans-unit.source: To understand RBAC concepts, let's look at some examples of common role definitions:
trans-unit.target: To understand RBAC concepts, let's look at some examples of common role definitions:

trans-unit.source: Role
trans-unit.target: Role

trans-unit.source: Allowed actions
trans-unit.target: Allowed actions

trans-unit.source: Reader
trans-unit.target: Reader

trans-unit.source: */read (Read anything)
trans-unit.target: */read (Read anything)

trans-unit.source: Owner
trans-unit.target: Owner

trans-unit.source: * (Read/write anything)
trans-unit.target: * (Read/write anything)

trans-unit.source: To assign the Reader role to User A for resource group named ExampleGroup, and the Owner role to User B for the whole subscription, you would assign the following:
trans-unit.target: To assign the Reader role to User A for resource group named ExampleGroup, and the Owner role to User B for the whole subscription, you would assign the following:

trans-unit.target: Role

trans-unit.target: Reader

trans-unit.target: User A

trans-unit.target: /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/examplegroup

trans-unit.target: Owner

trans-unit.target: /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}

trans-unit.source: Example Scenarios
trans-unit.target: Example Scenarios

trans-unit.source: In this topic, you will see how to perform the following common scenarios through Azure PowerShell, Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows, and REST API.
trans-unit.target: In this topic, you will see how to perform the following common scenarios through Azure PowerShell, Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows, and REST API.

trans-unit.source: View the available roles in a subscription and the permitted actions for those roles.
trans-unit.target: View the available roles in a subscription and the permitted actions for those roles.

trans-unit.source: Grant Reader permissions to members of a group across the subscription.
trans-unit.target: Grant Reader permissions to members of a group across the subscription.

trans-unit.source: Grant Contributor permissions to an application to allow the application to manage resources inside the resource group.
trans-unit.target: Grant Contributor permissions to an application to allow the application to manage resources inside the resource group.

trans-unit.source: Grant Owner permissions on a particular website to a single user.
trans-unit.target: Grant Owner permissions on a particular website to a single user.

trans-unit.source: List auditing logs of resource group.
trans-unit.target: List auditing logs of resource group.

trans-unit.source: How to use PowerShell to manage access
trans-unit.target: How to use PowerShell to manage access

trans-unit.source: If you do not already have the latest version of Azure PowerShell installed, see <link><linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you do not already have the latest version of Azure PowerShell installed, see <link><linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure PowerShell console.
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure PowerShell console.

trans-unit.source: Login to your Azure account with your credentials.
trans-unit.target: Login to your Azure account with your credentials.

trans-unit.source: The command returns information about your account.
trans-unit.target: The command returns information about your account.

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple subscriptions, provide the subscription id you wish to use for deployment.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple subscriptions, provide the subscription id you wish to use for deployment.

trans-unit.source: Switch to the Azure Resource Manager module.
trans-unit.target: Switch to the Azure Resource Manager module.

trans-unit.source: View available roles
trans-unit.target: View available roles

trans-unit.source: To view all available roles for your subscription run the Get-AzureRoleDefinition command.
trans-unit.target: To view all available roles for your subscription run the Get-AzureRoleDefinition command.

trans-unit.source: Grant Reader permission to a group for the subscription.
trans-unit.target: Grant Reader permission to a group for the subscription.

trans-unit.source: Review the Reader role definition by providing the role name when running the Get-AzureRoleDefinition command.
trans-unit.target: Review the Reader role definition by providing the role name when running the Get-AzureRoleDefinition command.

trans-unit.source: Check that the allowed actions are what you intend to assign.
trans-unit.target: Check that the allowed actions are what you intend to assign.

trans-unit.source: Get the required security group by running the Get-AzureADGroup command.
trans-unit.target: Get the required security group by running the Get-AzureADGroup command.

trans-unit.source: Provide the actual name of the group in your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Provide the actual name of the group in your subscription.

trans-unit.source: ExampleAuditorGroup is shown below.
trans-unit.target: ExampleAuditorGroup is shown below.

trans-unit.source: Create the role assignment for the auditor security group.
trans-unit.target: Create the role assignment for the auditor security group.

trans-unit.source: When the command completes, the new role assignment is returned.
trans-unit.target: When the command completes, the new role assignment is returned.

trans-unit.source: Grant Contributor permission to an application for a resource group.
trans-unit.target: Grant Contributor permission to an application for a resource group.

trans-unit.source: Review the Contributor role definition by providing the role name when running the Get-AzureRoleDefinition command.
trans-unit.target: Review the Contributor role definition by providing the role name when running the Get-AzureRoleDefinition command.

trans-unit.source: Check that the allowed actions are what you intend to assign.
trans-unit.target: Check that the allowed actions are what you intend to assign.

trans-unit.source: Get the service principal object Id by running the Get-AzureADServicePrincipal command and providing the name of the application in your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Get the service principal object Id by running the Get-AzureADServicePrincipal command and providing the name of the application in your subscription.

trans-unit.source: ExampleApplication is shown below.
trans-unit.target: ExampleApplication is shown below.

trans-unit.source: Create the role assignments for the service principal by running the New-AzureRoleAssignment command.
trans-unit.target: Create the role assignments for the service principal by running the New-AzureRoleAssignment command.

trans-unit.source: For a more thorough explanation of setting up an Azure Active Directory application and a service principal, see <link><linkText>Authenticating a Service Principal with Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For a more thorough explanation of setting up an Azure Active Directory application and a service principal, see <link><linkText>Authenticating a Service Principal with Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Grant Owner permissions to a user for a resource.
trans-unit.target: Grant Owner permissions to a user for a resource.

trans-unit.source: Review the Owner role definition by providing the role name when running the Get-AzureRoleDefinition command.
trans-unit.target: Review the Owner role definition by providing the role name when running the Get-AzureRoleDefinition command.

trans-unit.source: Check that the allowed actions are what you intend to assign.
trans-unit.target: Check that the allowed actions are what you intend to assign.

trans-unit.source: Create the role assignments for the user.
trans-unit.target: Create the role assignments for the user.

trans-unit.source: List auditing logs of resource group.
trans-unit.target: List auditing logs of resource group.

trans-unit.source: To get the auditing log for a resource group, run the Get-AzureResourceGroupLog command.
trans-unit.target: To get the auditing log for a resource group, run the Get-AzureResourceGroupLog command.

trans-unit.source: How to use the REST API
trans-unit.target: How to use the REST API

trans-unit.source: To manage role-based access control through the Azure Resource Manager REST API, you must set common headers and parameters (including authentication tokens) when sending the requests.
trans-unit.target: To manage role-based access control through the Azure Resource Manager REST API, you must set common headers and parameters (including authentication tokens) when sending the requests.

trans-unit.source: For information see <link><linkText>Common parameters and headers</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information see <link><linkText>Common parameters and headers</linkText><title></title></link>.
